p: The median incubation period of COVID-19 has been determined to be 5.7 days, with 97.5% of patients developing symptoms within 12.5 days of exposure [ 21]. The most common symptoms are non-specific, including fever (88%), fatigue (70%), dry cough (67.7%), anorexia (40%), and myalgia (35%). Anosmia and dysgeusia have also been reported as notable and somewhat specific symptoms. Upper respiratory tract symptoms such as rhinorrhea are conspicuously less common. Gastrointestinal symptoms, including nausea and diarrhea [ 22, 23] are also less common.
